Hi, I had a look at the code, and I would like to work on this.

My approach:

Switch from grid to flex display for the Coverage Card.
Ensure Payor ID and Payor Name share the same row by default.
If Payor ID is too long, Payor Name will shift to the next line to accommodate the overflow while maintaining readability.
Use Tailwind’s flex, flex-wrap, and min-w-0 utilities to manage wrapping and alignment.
ETA: 1 day

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11413
activity.text:
I propose converting the diagnoses table into a responsive card layout to improve readability on mobile devices. My approach involves the following steps:

Responsive Layout with Tailwind CSS:

Use flex and grid utilities to switch between a table on larger screens and cards on smaller screens using Tailwind's responsive breakpoints (e.g., sm:, md:, lg:).

Card Design:

Each diagnosis will be displayed as a card with the following fields:

Diagnosis name (highlighted for emphasis)
Date and status (in a smaller font or a badge for clarity)
Any action buttons (if present) for quick interactions

Implementation Plan:

Refactor the table component to conditionally render either a table (for md: screens and above) or a card layout (for smaller screens).
Apply Tailwind’s hidden, block, and flex classes to toggle views efficiently.
Ensure that sorting and filtering logic remains functional in both layouts.
Testing:

Verify the layout on common devices (iOS, Android, and desktops).
Ensure no regression in features and maintain accessibility (e.g., aria-label for interactive elements).
Expected Timeline:
ETA 1 day

Additional Context:
I will ensure the new card layout adheres to the app’s design system and maintains a clean, user-friendly experience. Let me know if you have any specific design preferences or additional fields to include.
